questionData.Question: When is flood insurance REQUIRED in order to obtain a loan?
questionData.Answer1: When the property is located in a Flood Hazard Zone.

questionData.Answer4: Never. Flood insurance is optional, and requiring special insurance in certain areas is called redlining.

questionData.Question: A salesperson qualified a minority couple with two children and defined their price range as between $110,000 and $120,000 for the three-bedroom house they wanted. They asked to look at two listings in a non-minority neighborhood. The salesperson did not show them the properties because they were priced under $90,000 and only had two small bedrooms. Did the salesperson act appropriately and why or why not?

questionData.Answer2: Yes, because it is the salesperson's job to tailor the properties shown to the needs of the buyer.

questionData.Answer4: Id, because the presence of children required granting occupancy if they desire it.

questionData.Question: A prospective buyer made an offer to purchase a property. The owner responded with a counteroffer. While the buyer was reviewing the counteroffer, the owner received a better offer. The owner can accept the second offer if
questionData.Answer1: It satisfies or exceeds all terms included in the counteroffer.

Which of the following statements is FALSE regarding the distribution of funds?

questionData.Question: The buyer wants to make the purchase offer contingent on a complex mortgage arrangement. The buyer's agent who is drawing up the contract should

questionData.Question: Three identical homes in a neighborhood were listed at the same time in a market where demand was constant. According to the law of supply and demand, which would have sold for the lowest price?
questionData.Answer4: Cannot tell from the information given.

questionData.Question: A licensee has an agency representation agreement with a buyer. When showing another company's listing, what obligation does the licensee have to the seller and the listing broker at the other company?
questionData.Answer1: There is no obligation because the buyer's agent has fiduciary duty to the buyer.
questionData.Answer2: The buyer's agent will be paid by the buyer and has no obligations to the seller or his agent.
questionData.Answer3: The listing broker works for the seller and has no right to any information from the buyer's broker or the buyer.
questionData.Answer4: Disclose the agency relationship when arranging the showing and disclose material information about the buyer if presenting an offer.

questionData.Question: In helping a buyer to select a lender, if the buyer believes he has good credit and his income is documentable as a salary and by tax returns, the licensee might recommend a mortgage banker, instead of a mortgage broker, for all of the following reasons EXCEPT
questionData.Answer2: Loan originator has knowledge of the underwriter's policies.
questionData.Answer3: More variety of loan programs available.
questionData.Answer4: Originator and lender are part of the same company.

questionData.Answer1: Cash price or amount of the loan.

questionData.Question: A property management plan may serve different purposes for different owners and generally has to strike a balance between preservation of the property's value and generation of income. Which of the following owners would MOST likely prefer a property manager who emphasizes maintenance of value over profitability?
questionData.Answer1: An individual entrepreneur who owns several apartment buildings.
questionData.Answer2: The Department of Housing and Urban Development.
questionData.Answer3: The investment division of a bank.
questionData.Answer4: A corporate Real Estate Investment Trust.

questionData.Question: A real estate salesperson is representing only the buyer in a transaction. Which of the following actions would be a violation of the salesperson's agency duties to the client?
questionData.Answer1: Disclosing the price the seller originally paid for the property.
questionData.Answer2: Disclosing the highest price the buyer is willing to pay.

questionData.Question: If all other factors are equal, in which location is a parking lot likely to bring the highest sales price?
questionData.Answer1: Residential district zones for two-story apartments.
questionData.Answer2: Business district zoned for a two-story commercial building.
questionData.Answer3: Business district zoned for a six-story office building.
questionData.Answer4: The price for the parking lot will be the same regardless of area and zoning.

questionData.Question: A buyer was negotiating the purchase of a house for himself. During a conversation with the seller, the seller agreed to include all kitchen appliances in the sale, and this fact was included in the sales contract. In this situation, if the seller takes the appliances with him, what recourse does the buyer have?
questionData.Answer1: The buyer has no recourse because he negotiated the sales himself.
questionData.Answer2: The buyer may declare the sales contract invalid.
questionData.Answer3: The buyer may sue the seller for partial performance.
questionData.Answer4: The buyer may sue the seller for specific performance.

questionData.Question: During the listing presentation, the seller questions the amount of commission to be paid and is told
questionData.Answer1: The amount is set by law.

questionData.Question: A salesperson lists a property with a contract that allows for subagency and dual agency. The salesperson is
questionData.Answer1: An independent contractor to the broker and an agent to the principal.
questionData.Answer2: An agent to the broker and a subagent to the principal.
questionData.Answer3: A subagent to the broker and an agent to the principal.
questionData.Answer4: An agent to the broker and an agent to the principal.

questionData.Answer1: A homeowner whose property is free of any mortgage encumbrance.

questionData.Question: A seller tells the listing agent that her home was treated for termites 10 years ago, so there are no termites now. Before listing the property, the agent should
questionData.Answer1: Tell the seller not to disclose, because the statute of limitations has run out.
questionData.Answer2: Tell the seller to disclose the termite treatment on the property disclosure.

Unrepresented buyers ask the licensee who listed the home whether they should order a property inspection as a part of their due diligence for the purchase of the home. Which of the following would be the most appropriate way for the listing agent to respond?
questionData.Answer1: If you feel it is in your best interest, please do so.
questionData.Answer2: Since I represent the seller, I am not able to answer your question.
questionData.Answer3: I am not aware of any issues that such an inspection would identify.
questionData.Answer4: Since the seller has provided a property disclosure, there should be no need for any further inspection.

questionData.Question: MOST closed real estate transactions should be reported to the IRS. Required information includes the seller name(s) and social security number(s) and
questionData.Answer1: Buyers name(s) and social security number(s).
questionData.Answer3: The mortgage lender's name and address.

questionData.Question: The real estate broker who is listing a house for sale should personally verify
questionData.Answer1: Whether radon is present in the basement.
questionData.Answer2: The number of square feet in the building
questionData.Answer3: That the electrical wiring is up to code.
questionData.Answer4: How much the seller originally paid for the property.

questionData.Question: Which of the following may be considered prima facie evidence of discrimination by a broker?
questionData.Answer1: Failure to show property in certain neighborhoods.
questionData.Answer2: Failure to display the equal housing poster at the broker's place of business.
questionData.Answer3: Failure to keep appointments with minority customers even though the broker was unaware of the minority status.
questionData.Answer4: Failure of a minority buyer to qualify for a loan arranged by the broker.

Which of the following acts is illegal?
questionData.Answer1: A non-licensed property owner sells a lot to a developer.
questionData.Answer2: A non-licensed banker collects rents on behalf of the bank.
questionData.Answer3: A licensed broker shares a commission with a real estate attorney.
questionData.Answer4: A licensed salesperson assists a licensed broker with purchase negotiations.
